groundTruth.text: AbstractThis study investigates experimentally the water retention behavior of granular soils from saturation to oven-dry state. The soil–water retention curve (SWRC) tests were conducted on a well-graded sand with clay using tensiometer and chilled-mirror hygrometer techniques. The soil samples were statically compacted at various water contents to different initial densities. The results showed that individual linear segments in the log–log graph could characterize the desorption process of capillary and adsorption water. A novel water retention model in a simple mathematical form was developed by conceptualizing the total water content as the sum of the suction-dependent capillary and adsorption components. The model parameters possess an unambiguous physical meaning. They can be easily calibrated based on the graphical properties of the test data using simple linear regression, which is a significant advantage over conventional SWRC models. The model was validated using the water retention data of the tested soil in this study and the available data of granular soils in the literature. The reproduced curves agree well with the experimental results. This study also analyzed the influence of compaction water content, initial density, and clay content on the capillary and adsorption components of the water retention curve. Additionally, the proposed framework provides a quick approximation method for the adsorption capacity, which plays an essential role in assessing the effective stress and the simulation of liquid film flow in unsaturated granular soils.

problem.title: Modeling Water Retention in Unsaturated Granular Soils: A Physics-Based Framework
problem.description: Developing a generalized, physically interpretable, and computationally efficient model to characterize the water retention behavior of unsaturated granular soils across varying suction ranges, soil compositions, and compaction states. The challenge lies in accurately partitioning capillary and adsorption water components while ensuring model parameters retain clear physical meaning and can be calibrated with minimal experimental effort.

templateData.title: Physics-Based Machine Learning Framework for Unsaturated Granular Soil Water Retention Modeling
templateData.description: Technical template for developing interpretable, physics-constrained ML models to characterize water retention curves (WRCs) in unsaturated granular soils, emphasizing capillary-adsorption partitioning, parameter physicality, and computational efficiency. Designed for cross-domain adaptability in geotechnical, agricultural, and environmental engineering applications.

templateProperty.label: Physically Interpretable Model Parameters
templateProperty.description: List of model parameters with direct physical meaning (e.g., pore-size distribution index, surface tension coefficient, adsorption energy scaling factor) and their theoretical constraints (units, ranges, and physical equations they derive from).

templateProperty.label: Capillary-Adsorption Partitioning Methodology
templateProperty.description: Technical approach for disentangling capillary (meniscus-dominated) and adsorption (surface-interaction-dominated) water components in the retention model, including mathematical formulations (e.g., Young-Laplace for capillarity, BET/isotherm models for adsorption) and coupling strategies.

templateProperty.label: Primary Soil Dataset
templateProperty.description: Named dataset(s) used for model development, including granular soil types (e.g., sand, silt, clay mixtures), suction range coverage (kPa), and compaction states (void ratio/porosity). Examples: UNSODA, HYDRUS-1D benchmark soils, or custom lab-measured datasets.

templateProperty.label: Suction Range Coverage (kPa)
templateProperty.description: Minimum and maximum suction values (in kPa) the model is validated for, partitioned into capillary (0–100 kPa) and adsorption-dominated (>100 kPa) regimes. Report as [min, max] array.

templateProperty.label: Hybrid Model Architecture
templateProperty.description: Named architecture combining physics-based equations (e.g., van Genuchten, Brooks-Corey) with ML components (e.g., Gaussian Processes, Neural ODEs, or symbolic regression). Specify the coupling mechanism (e.g., residual learning, parameter substitution, or constraint optimization).

templateProperty.label: Parameter Calibration Effort (Experiments)
templateProperty.description: Number of distinct laboratory experiments (e.g., pressure plate, vapor equilibrium, or centrifuge tests) required to calibrate the model parameters, including suction-controlled and compaction-state variations.

templateProperty.label: Computational Efficiency (Inference Time per WRC)
templateProperty.description: Average inference time (in milliseconds) to predict a single water retention curve (WRC) on a standard CPU (specify hardware, e.g., Intel i7-12700K), including preprocessing. Report as median ± standard deviation over 1000 predictions.

templateProperty.label: Physics-Based Constraints
templateProperty.description: List of hard constraints enforced during training/inference (e.g., monotonicity of WRC, asymptotic behavior at saturation/residual water content, or energy conservation in adsorption). Include mathematical expressions and enforcement methods (e.g., loss penalties, architectural priors).

templateProperty.label: Cross-Validation Strategy
templateProperty.description: Technical approach for validating generalization across soil types/compactions (e.g., leave-one-soil-out, suction-range stratified splits, or synthetic data augmentation). Specify train/test ratios and repetition count.

templateProperty.label: Benchmark Models
templateProperty.description: Named baseline models compared against (e.g., van Genuchten closed-form, Fredlund-Xing, or data-driven models like Random Forest/WRC-Net). Include citations or repository links if public.

templateProperty.label: Primary Error Metrics
templateProperty.description: Quantitative metrics used for evaluation, partitioned by suction regime (e.g., RMSE for capillary, MAE for adsorption, or R² for full-range). Specify units (e.g., volumetric water content %) and weighting schemes if applied.

templateProperty.label: Soil Composition Generalization Score
templateProperty.description: Normalized score (0–1) quantifying model performance consistency across varying grain-size distributions (e.g., uniformity coefficient Cu, clay fraction %). Derived from error metrics aggregated over distinct soil classes.

templateProperty.label: Compaction State Robustness (ΔError/ΔPorosity)
templateProperty.description: Sensitivity of model error (e.g., RMSE) to changes in porosity (report as slope of error vs. porosity regression line, in % water content per unit porosity). Indicates robustness to compaction variations.

templateProperty.label: Uncertainty Quantification Method
templateProperty.description: Technical approach for estimating prediction uncertainty (e.g., Bayesian NN, ensemble methods, or physics-guided Monte Carlo). Specify how aleatoric (data noise) and epistemic (model) uncertainties are separated.

templateProperty.label: Experimental Calibration Protocol
templateProperty.description: Step-by-step laboratory protocol for calibrating model parameters, including equipment (e.g., pressure plates, tensiometers), suction control methods, and repeatability metrics (e.g., coefficient of variation for repeated measurements).

templateProperty.label: Source Code Repository
templateProperty.description: URL to the version-controlled repository containing implementation (GitHub, GitLab, etc.). Must include documentation for reproducibility (e.g., requirements.txt, example notebooks).

templateProperty.label: Publication DOI
templateProperty.description: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) for the primary research paper or preprint describing the model. Used for citation and validation traceability.

templateProperty.label: Data Augmentation Technique
templateProperty.description: Method for generating synthetic WRC data to improve generalization (e.g., physics-based perturbation of suction-water content pairs, or GANs conditioned on soil properties). Specify validation steps to ensure physical plausibility.

templateProperty.label: Transferability Test Results
templateProperty.description: Performance degradation (ΔRMSE %) when applying the model to soils outside the training distribution (e.g., extreme clay/sand ratios or organic content). Report as [median ΔRMSE, 95% CI] across test cases.

usability.comments: recommend to improve UI handling issues like editing values of properties and then the info icon was gone or auto entering/insertion of values.

efficiency.comments: It is indeed much better than traditional ORKG workflow

quality.comments: Overall the quality is good other than some revision of the output of values for the propoerties which is recommended to using specific structure for outputs

overall.comments: Overall the tool was responsive and helpful in analyzing the important portions in a paper. A great analyser assistent.
